meanings.definition: The essential nature or substance of something
meanings.sent1: The hypostasis of the plant lies in its ability to photosynthesize.
meanings.sent2: Understanding the hypostasis of a problem is crucial to finding a solution.
meanings.sent3: The hypostasis of the joke was lost on the young audience.
meanings.sent4: In the story, the old house served as the hypostasis of mystery and intrigue.
meanings.sent5: The artist captured the hypostasis of joy in her painting.

meanings.definition: A person's underlying personality or individuality
meanings.sent1: Her hypostasis as a caring friend was evident in the way she always listened.
meanings.sent2: It takes time to truly understand someone's hypostasis.
meanings.sent3: The hypostasis of the shy student surprised everyone when he gave a speech.
meanings.sent4: His hypostasis shone like a beacon of kindness in a world of chaos.
meanings.sent5: The hypostasis of the character made him unforgettable to the readers.
